person.persName: John Hardin McHenry, Jr. (Daviess County, Kentucky, attorney and col 2nd Reg KY Enr Militia)

body.p: Daviess County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Hardin McHenry and Hannah Davis McHenry. Medical student in Ohio County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned thirteen enslaved persons in Ohio County in 1850. Attorney in Owensboro, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Owensboro in 1860. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in 1860. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from December 1861 to December 9, 1862. Dismissed from service on December 9, 1862, by order of Secretary of War Edwin M. Stanton after issuing an order returning enslaved persons to their masters. Attorney in Daviess County in 1863. Served in the 2nd Regiment Kentucky Enrolled Militia as colonel until July 7, 1864.
